Description: Body sherd of Attic pottery Gordion cup; interior glazed with reserved band at top of wall; exterior: handle zone reserved with black lines top and bottom; lower wall glazed; inscription in handle zone.
Curator's comments: The sherd belongs to the same vessel as British Museum 1888,0601.424, 1888,0601.427, 1888,0601.215, 1948,0815.1, 1948,0815.2 and Cambridge, Fitzwilliam GR.206.1894. See Hirayama, H. 2010 Kleitias and Attic Black-figure Vases in the Sixth Century B.C., 89 and pl. 25, A17,5.
Bibliographic references: Vase / Catalogue of Vases in the British Museum (B601.4.2)
